goals.question: What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each penguin species
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the proportion of each species in the dataset and if there is any class imbalance.

goals.question: What is the average body mass of each penguin species?
goals.visualization: Grouped box plot of body mass by species
goals.rationale: This helps us compare the body mass of each species and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of flipper length vs body mass
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there is a correlation between flipper length and body mass and if it varies by species.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bill length and depth by penguin sex?
goals.visualization: Violin plot of bill length and depth by sex
goals.rationale: This helps us compare the bill characteristics of male and female penguins and identify any significant differences.

goals.question: What is the distribution of body mass by island?
goals.visualization: Box plot of body mass by island
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there are any differences in body mass between penguins from different islands.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    species_count = data['species'].value_counts()
    plt.bar(species_count.index, species_count.values)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of penguin species in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Species')
    plt.ylabel('Count')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['body_mass_g'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.set_title('What is the average body mass of each penguin species?', wrap=True)
    ax.boxplot([data[data.species == 'Adelie'].body_mass_g, data[data.species == 'Chinstrap'].body_mass_g, data[data.species == 'Gentoo'].body_mass_g], labels=['Adelie', 'Chinstrap', 'Gentoo'])
    ax.set_xlabel('Species')
    ax.set_ylabel('Body Mass (g)')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    species = data['species'].unique()
    colors = ['red', 'green', 'blue']
    for i, s in enumerate(species):
        species_data = data[data['species'] == s]
        ax.scatter(species_data['body_mass_g'], species_data['flipper_length_mm'], color=colors[i], label=s)
    ax.set_xlabel('Body Mass (g)')
    ax.set_ylabel('Flipper Length (mm)')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the relationship between flipper length and body mass?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.violinplot([data[data['sex'] == 'Male']['bill_length_mm'], data[data['sex'] == 'Female']['bill_length_mm']], positions=[1, 2], showmeans=True, showextrema=True, showmedians=True)
    ax.violinplot([data[data['sex'] == 'Male']['bill_depth_mm'], data[data['sex'] == 'Female']['bill_depth_mm']], positions=[4, 5], showmeans=True, showextrema=True, showmedians=True)
    ax.set_xticks([1.5, 4.5])
    ax.set_xticklabels(['Bill Length', 'Bill Depth'])
    ax.set_ylabel('mm')
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of bill length and depth by penguin sex?')
    ax.legend(['Male', 'Female'])
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['body_mass_g'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.boxplot([data[data['island'] == 'Biscoe']['body_mass_g'], 
                data[data['island'] == 'Dream']['body_mass_g'], 
                data[data['island'] == 'Torgersen']['body_mass_g']], 
               labels=['Biscoe', 'Dream', 'Torgersen'])
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of body mass by island?')
    ax.set_xlabel('Island')
    ax.set_ylabel('Body Mass (g)')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
